isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 5000i, 9100i, 9200i, 9400i, 9900i MODELS - Starting 03/01/1999 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - EXPANSION VALVE

warning.para: Before performing any of the following procedures, read the SERVICE WARNINGS. Failure to read the service warnings and to be aware of the dangers involved when working with refrigerant could lead to serious personal injury.

step1.para: Make sure the key switch and the A/C switch are in the OFF position.
Recover the refrigerant from the Air Conditioning system. Refer to s16019, AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the Master Service Manual.
Under the cab, remove the three screws that secure the plastic cover over the high and low pressure switches on the expansion valve. Remove the cover.
Disconnect the electrical connectors from the low and high pressure switches ( Figure 6).

figure.caption: Figure 6. Low and High Pressure Switches (Refrigerant Lines not Shown)

step1.para: Remove the 10 mm hex lock nut that holds the two refrigerant lines in place on the expansion valve. Remove the lines from the expansion valve. Cap or plug the ends of both lines.
If the low and high pressure switches are being removed from the expansion valve, use a backup wrench to prevent the Shrader valves from being loosened or removed ( Figure 7).
Remove two 5/32 inch Allen head capscrews that secure the expansion valve to the evaporator ( Figure 8) and remove the expansion valve.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Use Backup Wrench When Removing/Installing Pressure Switches

step1.para: Cap or plug the inlet and outlet tubes on the evaporator.
Keep the openings on the expansion valve covered to keep them clean if the valve is to be reinstalled.

important.para: Before installing new O-rings in the following steps, verify that the old O-rings were completely removed.

step1.para: Lubricate new O-rings with MINERAL OIL. Remove caps or plugs, and install new O-rings on the inlet and outlet tubes on the evaporator ( Figure 9).

figure.caption: Figure 9. Install O-Rings on Evaporator Tubes

step1.para: Install expansion valve on the evaporator tubes with the stud facing out and secure in place with the two 5/32 inch Allen head capscrews removed previously ( Figure 8). Tighten the capscrews to 79 to 89 lbf-in (8.9 to 10 Nm).

caution.para: To prevent damage to the threads in the expansion valve, use two wrenches to tighten both pressure cut-off switches ( Figure 7).

step1.para: Install the high and low pressure cut-off switches ( Figure 7) (if removed).
Install new O-rings, lubricated with MINERAL OIL, onto the high and low pressure refrigerant line fittings before inserting the fittings into the expansion valve ( Figure 7).

caution.para: In the following step, do not over-tighten the 10 mm hex lock nut. Too much torque will strip the threads on the stud, which will require replacing the expansion valve.

step1.para: Install both refrigerant lines on the expansion valve along with the plate that holds them in place. Secure the plate onto the stud using the 10 mm hex lock nut. Tighten the lock nut to 80 to 90 lbf-in (9 to 10 Nm).
Connect electrical connectors to both pressure switches ( Figure 6).
Install plastic cover over the high and low pressure switches on the expansion valve with the three screws removed in Step 3 of Remove.
Evacuate and charge the air conditioning system. Refer to s16019, AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the Master Service Manual.
